timeline.bodyText:
Did you notice that streamSegments is guarded by a lock?
This tells you two things:

Wrap this call in a synchronized block
Make a copy of the values() collection in that block and iterate over the copy. That will prevent your iterator from failing if some other thread modifies the collection while you iterate through it.

timeline.bodyText:
I've been thinking. ...
This could be achieved by doing something like:
(constructor)
innerIterator = client.listObjects(config.getBucket(), config.getPrefix()).stream()
                      .flatMap(r -> r.getObjects().stream())
                      .filter(patternMatchIPredicate)
                      .map(this::toSegmentProperties)
                      .iterator()

hasNext: return innerIterator.hasNext()
next: return innerIterator.next()
toSegmentProperties: put the code you have in next here
Does this work? It may require a couple of adjustments but it should eliminate the need for all this extra code.
Please fix the other iterators too.
